project1.title: Muralville
project1.description: Muralville, a murals finder app, is my love letter to the talented mural artists in Nashville, TN. This app allows users to find, add, and keep track of their favorite murals around the city. Built with React using a flat-data structure in Firebase. The Leaflet API was used for the map component and ESRI and Bing Maps for GeoSearch and Autosuggest capabilities. Modals and forms created using Reactstrap.
project1.technologiesUsed: React.js, Axios, Firebase, JavaScript, Sass, Reactstrap, Leaflet

project2.title: Band ★ Aid
project2.description: Band Aid is my full-stack capstone at NSS. It is a networking platform to connect bands to talented musicians. It is built on ASP.NET Core using C#, Dapper, and Microsoft SQL server for scaffolding, database integration and management . Front end technologies include ReactJS, Firebase for OAuth, Axios, and Reactstrap.
project2.technologiesUsed: C#, ASP.NET Core, Dapper, React.js, Axios, Firebase, JavaScript, Sass, Reactstrap

project3.title: Skull & Daisy
project3.description: Skull & Daisy is a storefront app built on ASP.NET Core using C#, Dapper, and Microsoft SQL Server for application scaffolding, database integration and management. My duties involved acting as Scrum Master implementing Agile development practices and providing the users and payment types models and API controllers using repository design pattern. On the front end, my primary contributions included writing authentication procedures using Firebase, implementing a seller dashboard to display sales history, and providing inventory management methods.
project3.technologiesUsed: C#, ASP.NET Core, Dapper, React.js, Axios, Firebase, JavaScript, Sass, Reactstrap

project4.title: Magic E8 Ball
project4.description: Magic E8 Ball is a recruiting tool for hiring managers looking to hire junior developers. This project grew out of my desire to get more experience with React, and to explore making shapes in pure CSS.

project5.title: Dev++
project5.description: As a junior developer, I want to be able to track all of the learning resources that I am interested in. Dev++ is a responsive CRUD application that allows users to add resources to track, and serves as a checklist. Users can sort these resources by type (blog, tutorial, documentation), and check them off as they are completed. This was my first project to build in React JS, and incorporates GitHub’s API to track commits. Modals and forms were created using Reactstrap. FontAwesome icons are used for ‘delete’ and ‘edit’ buttons.

project6.title: Get Things Done
project6.description: Every developer worth their salt codes a To-Do app at some point. This one is mine. It utilizes full CRUD methods to interact with Firebase.
project6.technologiesUsed: Webpack, Axios, Firebase, JavaScript, ES6 Modules, Sass, Bootstrap

project7.title: Lego Builder
project7.description: A small lego-man builder app. User can make a lego person creation, randomize a lego person, or save individual lego characters. The name of each lego creation corresponds to each lego piece selected. As user swaps out lego parts, the name will change to reflect the newly chosen piece.
project7.technologiesUsed: Webpack, JavaScript, ES6 Modules, Axios, Firebase, Bootstrap, Sass
